event.title: was named after Scottish immigrants, and early settlers, Mary and James Kelso, who had cattle property in 1878

data.event: Kelso was named after Scottish immigrants, and early settlers, Mary and James Kelso, who had cattle property in 1878 called Laudham Park on Five Head Creek.

event.title: construction of the Ross River Dam in 1970

data.event: To make way for construction of the Ross River Dam in 1970, the Townsville City Council resumed 1620ha of the property's best grazing land.

event.title: the construction of the dam and the rest is now

data.event: Most of what was Laudham Park is today under water due to the construction of the dam and the rest is now the suburb of Kelso.
